person.persName: James Prentis (Virginia-born, Kentucky merchant and farmer in Hancock County)

body.p: A Virginia-born, Kentucky merchant and farmer. Educated at William & Mary College. Graduated with a law degree. Married to Lucy W. Baugh Prentis. Father of W. T. Prentis, Robert C. Prentis, A. B. Prentis, Ann Prentis, Margaret J. Prentis, Earnest Prentis, Lucy T. Prentis, Hallack Prentis, and Beauscan Prentis. Moved to Hancock County, Kentucky in 1845. Owned three enslaved persons in 1860. Purchased land on which Lewisport, Kentucky was founded. Served as magistrate in Hancock County, Kentucky. One of the founders of the Lewisport Pond Draining Company in 1858. Worked as a merchant in Lewisport with his children.
